intro: Stenanona stenopetala, commonly known as the narrow-petaled stenanona, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow petals and is often found in dry, open habitats. Its flowers are typically pink or white, and it produces capsules as its fruit. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
